document.masterDocTitle: Review of the millipede genus Glyphiulus Gervais, 1847, with descriptions of new species from Southeast Asia (Diplopoda, Spirostreptida, Cambalopsidae). Part 1: the granulatus-group

paragraph.heading:
KEY TO SPECIES OF
GLYPHIULUS GERVAIS, 1847 OF THE
GRANULATUS- GROUP

paragraph.keyLead: 2. Midbody segments in cross-section slightly compressed laterally ( Fig. 13C ). Legs slightly elongate, about as long as midbody height. Yunnan Prov. , China ............................... 3

— Antennae stout ( Fig. 14A ). Spine at base of claw less than half as long as claw ( Fig. 14D ) .................................................................................................
G. semigranulatus
n. sp.

5. Paraprocts evidently elevated, ridge-like along midline ( Fig. 17F ). Anterior gonopods with thicker telopodites, distomedial corners subunciform ( Fig. 18G ). Northern Laos .......... ...........................................................................................................
G. bedosae
n. sp.

— Legs only slightly shorter than midbody height. Antennae slightly longer and more slender (more like in Figure 26A ). Anterior gonopods much like in Figure 18G , distomedial processes low and broadly rounded. Hubei Prov. , China ............................
G. lipsorum

keyLead.keyStep:
7. Collum conspicuously hypertrophied due to crests I-IV, but paramedian crests complete and contrastingly low in anterior 1/3 collum. Vestigial 2-segmented leg remains on male sternum 1. Anterior gonopods much as in
G. granulatus
( Fig. 5A, B ), distomedial processes similarly high but much wider. Posterior gonopods strongly constricted in distal 1/3. Mountains of central Vietnam ..................................................................
G. capucinus

paragraph.keyLead: — Collum not hypertrophied, often some of its crests more or less obliterated. Male legs 1 either completely reduced to 1-segmented tubercular (usually) or leg-like. Anterior
